member.summary: Called to retrieve the root window rectangle in screen coordinates. Return true if the rectangle was provided.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.GetViewRect(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRectangle@)
member.summary: Called to retrieve the view rectangle which is relative to screen coordinates. Return true if the rectangle was provided.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.GetScreenPoint(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Called to retrieve the translation from view coordinates to actual screen coordinates. Return true if the screen coordinates were provided.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.GetScreenInfo(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefScreenInfo)
member.summary: Called to allow the client to fill in the CefScreenInfo object with appropriate values. Return true if the |screen_info| structure has been modified. If the screen info rectangle is left empty the rectangle from GetViewRect will be used. If the rectangle is still empty or invalid popups may not be drawn correctly.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.OnPopupShow(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when the browser wants to show or hide the popup widget. The popup should be shown if |show| is true and hidden if |show| is false.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.OnPopupSize(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRectangle)
member.summary: Called when the browser wants to move or resize the popup widget. |rect| contains the new location and size in view coordinates.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.OnPaint(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefPaintElementType,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRectangle[],System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when an element should be painted. Pixel values passed to this method are scaled relative to view coordinates based on the value of CefScreenInfo.device_scale_factor returned from GetScreenInfo. |type| indicates whether the element is the view or the popup widget. |buffer| contains the pixel data for the whole image. |dirtyRects| contains the set of rectangles in pixel coordinates that need to be repainted. |buffer| will be |width|*|height|*4 bytes in size and represents a BGRA image with an upper-left origin.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.OnCursorChange(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,System.IntPtr,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefCursorType,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefCursorInfo)
member.summary: Called when the browser's cursor has changed. If |type| is CT_CUSTOM then |custom_cursor_info| will be populated with the custom cursor information.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.StartDragging(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefDragData,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefDragOperationsMask,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when the user starts dragging content in the web view. Contextual information about the dragged content is supplied by |drag_data|. (|x|, |y|) is the drag start location in screen coordinates. OS APIs that run a system message loop may be used within the StartDragging call. Return false to abort the drag operation. Don't call any of CefBrowserHost::DragSource*Ended* methods after returning false. Return true to handle the drag operation. Call CefBrowserHost::DragSourceEndedAt and DragSourceSystemDragEnded either synchronously or asynchronously to inform the web view that the drag operation has ended.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderHandler.OnScrollOffsetChanged(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Called when the scroll offset has changed.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler
member.summary: Class used to implement render process callbacks. The methods of this class will be called on the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) unless otherwise indicated.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnRenderThreadCreated(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefListValue)
member.summary: Called after the render process main thread has been created.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnWebKitInitialized
member.summary: Called after WebKit has been initialized.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnBrowserCreated(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser)
member.summary: Called after a browser has been created. When browsing cross-origin a new browser will be created before the old browser with the same identifier is destroyed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnBrowserDestroyed(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser)
member.summary: Called before a browser is destroyed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.GetLoadHandler
member.summary: Return the handler for browser load status events.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnBeforeNavigation(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefNavigationType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called before browser navigation. Return true to cancel the navigation or false to allow the navigation to proceed. The |request| object cannot be modified in this callback.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnContextCreated(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context)
member.summary: Called immediately after the V8 context for a frame has been created. To retrieve the JavaScript 'window' object use the CefV8Context::GetGlobal() method. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnContextReleased(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context)
member.summary: Called immediately before the V8 context for a frame is released. No references to the context should be kept after this method is called.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnUncaughtException(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace)
member.summary: Called for global uncaught exceptions in a frame. Execution of this callback is disabled by default. To enable set CefSettings.uncaught_exception_stack_size > 0.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnFocusedNodeChanged(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefDomNode)
member.summary: Called when a new node in the the browser gets focus. The |node| value may be empty if no specific node has gained focus. The node object passed to this method represents a snapshot of the DOM at the time this method is executed. DOM objects are only valid for the scope of this method. Do not keep references to or attempt to access any DOM objects outside the scope of this method.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRenderProcessHandler.OnProcessMessageReceived(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefProcessId,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefProcessMessage)
member.summary: Called when a new message is received from a different process. Return true if the message was handled or false otherwise. Do not keep a reference to or attempt to access the message outside of this callback.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest
member.summary: Class used to represent a web request. The methods of this class may be called on any thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.Create

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Returns true if this object is read-only.

member.summary: Gets or sets the fully qualified URL.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the request method type. The value will default to POST if post data is provided and GET otherwise.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.SetReferrer(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy)
member.summary: Set the referrer URL and policy. If non-empty the referrer URL must be fully qualified with an HTTP or HTTPS scheme component. Any username, password or ref component will be removed.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.ReferrerURL
member.summary: Get the referrer URL.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.ReferrerPolicy
member.summary: Get the referrer policy.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.PostData
member.summary: Get the post data.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.GetHeaderMap
member.summary: Get the header values. Will not include the Referer value if any.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.SetHeaderMap(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Set the header values. If a Referer value exists in the header map it will be removed and ignored.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.Set(System.String,System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefPostData,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Set all values at one time.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.Options
member.summary: Get the options used in combination with CefUrlRequest.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.FirstPartyForCookies
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to the first party for cookies used in combination with CefWebURLRequest.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.ResourceType
member.summary: Get the resource type for this request. Only available in the browser process.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.TransitionType
member.summary: Get the transition type for this request. Only available in the browser process and only applies to requests that represent a main frame or sub-frame navigation.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest.Identifier
member.summary: Returns the globally unique identifier for this request or 0 if not specified. Can be used by CefRequestHandler implementations in the browser process to track a single request across multiple callbacks.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestCallback
member.summary: Callback interface used for asynchronous continuation of url requests.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestCallback.Continue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Continue the url request. If |allow| is true the request will be continued. Otherwise, the request will be canceled.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestCallback.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the url request.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext
member.summary: A request context provides request handling for a set of related browser or URL request objects. A request context can be specified when creating a new browser via the CefBrowserHost static factory methods or when creating a new URL request via the CefURLRequest static factory methods. Browser objects with different request contexts will never be hosted in the same render process. Browser objects with the same request context may or may not be hosted in the same render process depending on the process model. Browser objects created indirectly via the JavaScript window.open function or targeted links will share the same render process and the same request context as the source browser. When running in single-process mode there is only a single render process (the main process) and so all browsers created in single-process mode will share the same request context. This will be the first request context passed into a CefBrowserHost static factory method and all other request context objects will be ignored.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.GetGlobalContext
member.summary: Returns the global context object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.CreateContext(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContextSettings,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContextHandler)
member.summary: Creates a new context object with the specified |settings| and optional |handler|.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.CreateContext(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContextHandler)
member.summary: Creates a new context object that shares storage with |other| and uses an optional |handler|.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.IsSame(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext)
member.summary: Returns true if this object is pointing to the same context as |that| object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.IsSharingWith(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext)
member.summary: Returns true if this object is sharing the same storage as |that| object.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.IsGlobal
member.summary: Returns true if this object is the global context. The global context is used by default when creating a browser or URL request with a NULL context argument.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.GetHandler
member.summary: Returns the handler for this context if any.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.CachePath
member.summary: Returns the cache path for this object. If empty an "incognito mode" in-memory cache is being used.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.GetDefaultCookieManager(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefCompletionCallback)
member.summary: Returns the default cookie manager for this object. This will be the global cookie manager if this object is the global request context. Otherwise, this will be the default cookie manager used when this request context does not receive a value via CefRequestContextHandler::GetCookieManager(). If |callback| is non-NULL it will be executed asnychronously on the IO thread after the manager's storage has been initialized.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.RegisterSchemeHandlerFactory(System.String,System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefSchemeHandlerFactory)
member.summary: Register a scheme handler factory for the specified |scheme_name| and optional |domain_name|. An empty |domain_name| value for a standard scheme will cause the factory to match all domain names. The |domain_name| value will be ignored for non-standard schemes. If |scheme_name| is a built-in scheme and no handler is returned by |factory| then the built-in scheme handler factory will be called. If |scheme_name| is a custom scheme then you must also implement the CefApp::OnRegisterCustomSchemes() method in all processes. This function may be called multiple times to change or remove the factory that matches the specified |scheme_name| and optional |domain_name|. Returns false if an error occurs. This function may be called on any thread in the browser process.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.ClearSchemeHandlerFactories
member.summary: Clear all registered scheme handler factories. Returns false on error. This function may be called on any thread in the browser process.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.PurgePluginListCache(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tells all renderer processes associated with this context to throw away their plugin list cache. If |reload_pages| is true they will also reload all pages with plugins. CefRequestContextHandler::OnBeforePluginLoad may be called to rebuild the plugin list cache.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.HasPreference(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if a preference with the specified |name| exists. This method must be called on the browser process UI thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.GetPreference(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value for the preference with the specified |name|. Returns NULL if the preference does not exist. The returned object contains a copy of the underlying preference value and modifications to the returned object will not modify the underlying preference value. This method must be called on the browser process UI thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.GetAllPreferences(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns all preferences as a dictionary. If |include_defaults| is true then preferences currently at their default value will be included. The returned object contains a copy of the underlying preference values and modifications to the returned object will not modify the underlying preference values. This method must be called on the browser process UI thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.CanSetPreference(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the preference with the specified |name| can be modified using SetPreference. As one example preferences set via the command-line usually cannot be modified. This method must be called on the browser process UI thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.SetPreference(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue,System.String@)
member.summary: Set the |value| associated with preference |name|. Returns true if the value is set successfully and false otherwise. If |value| is NULL the preference will be restored to its default value. If setting the preference fails then |error| will be populated with a detailed description of the problem. This method must be called on the browser process UI thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.ClearCertificateExceptions(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefCompletionCallback)
member.summary: Clears all certificate exceptions that were added as part of handling CefRequestHandler::OnCertificateError(). If you call this it is recommended that you also call CloseAllConnections() or you risk not being prompted again for server certificates if you reconnect quickly. If |callback| is non-NULL it will be executed on the UI thread after completion.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.CloseAllConnections(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefCompletionCallback)
member.summary: Clears all active and idle connections that Chromium currently has. This is only recommended if you have released all other CEF objects but don't yet want to call CefShutdown(). If |callback| is non-NULL it will be executed on the UI thread after completion.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.ResolveHost(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefResolveCallback)
member.summary: Attempts to resolve |origin| to a list of associated IP addresses. |callback| will be executed on the UI thread after completion.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext.ResolveHostCached(System.String,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Attempts to resolve |origin| to a list of associated IP addresses using cached data. |resolved_ips| will be populated with the list of resolved IP addresses or empty if no cached data is available. Returns ERR_NONE on success. This method must be called on the browser process IO thread.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContextHandler
member.summary: Implement this interface to provide handler implementations. The handler instance will not be released until all objects related to the context have been destroyed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContextHandler.GetCookieManager
member.summary: Called on the browser process IO thread to retrieve the cookie manager. If this method returns NULL the default cookie manager retrievable via CefRequestContext::GetDefaultCookieManager() will be used.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContextHandler.OnBeforePluginLoad(System.String,System.String,System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefWebPluginInfo,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefPluginPolicy@)
member.summary: Called on multiple browser process threads before a plugin instance is loaded. |mime_type| is the mime type of the plugin that will be loaded. |plugin_url| is the content URL that the plugin will load and may be empty. |top_origin_url| is the URL for the top-level frame that contains the plugin when loading a specific plugin instance or empty when building the initial list of enabled plugins for 'navigator.plugins' JavaScript state. |plugin_info| includes additional information about the plugin that will be loaded. |plugin_policy| is the recommended policy. Modify |plugin_policy| and return true to change the policy. Return false to use the recommended policy. The default plugin policy can be set at runtime using the `--plugin-policy=[allow|detect|block]` command-line flag. Decisions to mark a plugin as disabled by setting |plugin_policy| to PLUGIN_POLICY_DISABLED may be cached when |top_origin_url| is empty. To purge the plugin list cache and potentially trigger new calls to this method call CefRequestContext::PurgePluginListCache.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler
member.summary: Implement this interface to handle events related to browser requests. The methods of this class will be called on the thread indicated.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnBeforeBrowse(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called on the UI thread before browser navigation. Return true to cancel the navigation or false to allow the navigation to proceed. The |request| object cannot be modified in this callback. CefLoadHandler::OnLoadingStateChange will be called twice in all cases. If the navigation is allowed CefLoadHandler::OnLoadStart and CefLoadHandler::OnLoadEnd will be called. If the navigation is canceled CefLoadHandler::OnLoadError will be called with an |errorCode| value of ERR_ABORTED.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnOpenUrlFromTab(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefWindowOpenDisposition,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called on the UI thread before OnBeforeBrowse in certain limited cases where navigating a new or different browser might be desirable. This includes user-initiated navigation that might open in a special way (e.g. links clicked via middle-click or ctrl + left-click) and certain types of cross-origin navigation initiated from the renderer process (e.g. navigating the top-level frame to/from a file URL). The |browser| and |frame| values represent the source of the navigation. The |target_disposition| value indicates where the user intended to navigate the browser based on standard Chromium behaviors (e.g. current tab, new tab, etc). The |user_gesture| value will be true if the browser navigated via explicit user gesture (e.g. clicking a link) or false if it navigated automatically (e.g. via the DomContentLoaded event). Return true to cancel the navigation or false to allow the navigation to proceed in the source browser's top-level frame.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnBeforeResourceLoad(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestCallback)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread before a resource request is loaded. The |request| object may be modified. Return RV_CONTINUE to continue the request immediately. Return RV_CONTINUE_ASYNC and call CefRequestCallback:: Continue() at a later time to continue or cancel the request asynchronously. Return RV_CANCEL to cancel the request immediately.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.GetResourceHandler(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread before a resource is loaded. To allow the resource to load normally return NULL. To specify a handler for the resource return a CefResourceHandler object. The |request| object should not be modified in this callback.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnResourceRedirect(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,System.String@)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread when a resource load is redirected. The |request| parameter will contain the old URL and other request-related information. The |new_url| parameter will contain the new URL and can be changed if desired. The |request| object cannot be modified in this callback.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnResourceResponse(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefResponse)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread when a resource response is received. To allow the resource to load normally return false. To redirect or retry the resource modify |request| (url, headers or post body) and return true. The |response| object cannot be modified in this callback.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.GetResourceResponseFilter(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefResponse)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread to optionally filter resource response content. |request| and |response| represent the request and response respectively and cannot be modified in this callback.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnResourceLoadComplete(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefResponse,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestStatus,System.Int64)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread when a resource load has completed. |request| and |response| represent the request and response respectively and cannot be modified in this callback. |status| indicates the load completion status. |received_content_length| is the number of response bytes actually read.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.GetAuthCredentials(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefFrame,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefAuthCallback)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread when the browser needs credentials from the user. |isProxy| indicates whether the host is a proxy server. |host| contains the hostname and |port| contains the port number. |realm| is the realm of the challenge and may be empty. |scheme| is the authentication scheme used, such as "basic" or "digest", and will be empty if the source of the request is an FTP server. Return true to continue the request and call CefAuthCallback::Continue() either in this method or at a later time when the authentication information is available. Return false to cancel the request immediately.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnQuotaRequest(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,System.String,System.Int64,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestCallback)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread when JavaScript requests a specific storage quota size via the webkitStorageInfo.requestQuota function. |origin_url| is the origin of the page making the request. |new_size| is the requested quota size in bytes. Return true to continue the request and call CefRequestCallback::Continue() either in this method or at a later time to grant or deny the request. Return false to cancel the request immediately.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestHandler.OnProtocolExecution(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefBrowser,System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Called on the UI thread to handle requests for URLs with an unknown protocol component. Set |allow_os_execution| to true to attempt execution via the registered OS protocol handler, if any. SECURITY WARNING: YOU SHOULD USE THIS METHOD TO ENFORCE RESTRICTIONS BASED ON SCHEME, HOST OR OTHER URL ANALYSIS BEFORE ALLOWING OS EXECUTION.

member.summary: Retrieve response header information. If the response length is not known set |response_length| to -1 and ReadResponse() will be called until it returns false. If the response length is known set |response_length| to a positive value and ReadResponse() will be called until it returns false or the specified number of bytes have been read. Use the |response| object to set the mime type, http status code and other optional header values. To redirect the request to a new URL set |redirectUrl| to the new URL. If an error occured while setting up the request you can call SetError() on |response| to indicate the error condition.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefResponseFilter
member.summary: Implement this interface to filter resource response content. The methods of this class will be called on the browser process IO thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefResponseFilter.InitFilter
member.summary: Initialize the response filter. Will only be called a single time. The filter will not be installed if this method returns false.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefResponseFilter.Filter(System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream,System.Int64,System.Int64@,System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Called to filter a chunk of data. |data_in| is the input buffer containing |data_in_size| bytes of pre-filter data (|data_in| will be NULL if |data_in_size| is zero). |data_out| is the output buffer that can accept up to |data_out_size| bytes of filtered output data. Set |data_in_read| to the number of bytes that were read from |data_in|. Set |data_out_written| to the number of bytes that were written into |data_out|. If some or all of the pre-filter data was read successfully but more data is needed in order to continue filtering (filtered output is pending) return RESPONSE_FILTER_NEED_MORE_DATA. If some or all of the pre-filter data was read successfully and all available filtered output has been written return RESPONSE_FILTER_DONE. If an error occurs during filtering return RESPONSE_FILTER_ERROR. This method will be called repeatedly until there is no more data to filter (resource response is complete), |data_in_read| matches |data_in_size| (all available pre-filter bytes have been read), and the method returns RESPONSE_FILTER_DONE or RESPONSE_FILTER_ERROR. Do not keep a reference to the buffers passed to this method.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefSchemeRegistrar
member.summary: Class that manages custom scheme registrations.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefSchemeRegistrar.AddCustomScheme(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Register a custom scheme. This method should not be called for the built-in HTTP, HTTPS, FILE, FTP, ABOUT and DATA schemes. If |is_standard| is true the scheme will be treated as a standard scheme. Standard schemes are subject to URL canonicalization and parsing rules as defined in the Common Internet Scheme Syntax RFC 1738 Section 3.1 available at http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc1738.txt In particular, the syntax for standard scheme URLs must be of the form:
[scheme]://[username]:[password]@[host]:[port]/[url-path]
Standard scheme URLs must have a host component that is a fully qualified domain name as defined in Section 3.5 of RFC 1034 [13] and Section 2.1 of RFC 1123. These URLs will be canonicalized to "scheme://host/path" in the simplest case and "scheme://username:password@host:port/path" in the most explicit case. For example, "scheme:host/path" and "scheme:///host/path" will both be canonicalized to "scheme://host/path". The origin of a standard scheme URL is the combination of scheme, host and port (i.e., "scheme://host:port" in the most explicit case). For non-standard scheme URLs only the "scheme:" component is parsed and canonicalized. The remainder of the URL will be passed to the handler as-is. For example, "scheme:///some%20text" will remain the same. Non-standard scheme URLs cannot be used as a target for form submission. If |is_local| is true the scheme will be treated as local (i.e., with the same security rules as those applied to "file" URLs). Normal pages cannot link to or access local URLs. Also, by default, local URLs can only perform XMLHttpRequest calls to the same URL (origin + path) that originated the request. To allow XMLHttpRequest calls from a local URL to other URLs with the same origin set the CefSettings.file_access_from_file_urls_allowed value to true. To allow XMLHttpRequest calls from a local URL to all origins set the CefSettings.universal_access_from_file_urls_allowed value to true. If |is_display_isolated| is true the scheme will be treated as display- isolated. This means that pages cannot display these URLs unless they are from the same scheme. For example, pages in another origin cannot create iframes or hyperlinks to URLs with this scheme. This function may be called on any thread. It should only be called once per unique |scheme_name| value. If |scheme_name| is already registered or if an error occurs this method will return false.

member.summary: Implement this interface for asynchronous task execution. If the task is posted successfully and if the associated message loop is still running then the Execute() method will be called on the target thread. If the task fails to post then the task object may be destroyed on the source thread instead of the target thread. For this reason be cautious when performing work in the task object destructor.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTaskRunner
member.summary: Class that asynchronously executes tasks on the associated thread. It is safe to call the methods of this class on any thread. CEF maintains multiple internal threads that are used for handling different types of tasks in different processes. The cef_thread_id_t definitions in cef_types.h list the common CEF threads. Task runners are also available for other CEF threads as appropriate (for example, V8 WebWorker threads).

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest
member.summary: Class used to make a URL request. URL requests are not associated with a browser instance so no CefClient callbacks will be executed. URL requests can be created on any valid CEF thread in either the browser or render process. Once created the methods of the URL request object must be accessed on the same thread that created it.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.Create(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequest,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefRequestContext)
member.summary: Create a new URL request. Only GET, POST, HEAD, DELETE and PUT request methods are supported. Multiple post data elements are not supported and elements of type PDE_TYPE_FILE are only supported for requests originating from the browser process. Requests originating from the render process will receive the same handling as requests originating from Web content -- if the response contains Content-Disposition or Mime-Type header values that would not normally be rendered then the response may receive special handling inside the browser (for example, via the file download code path instead of the URL request code path). The |request| object will be marked as read-only after calling this method. In the browser process if |request_context| is empty the global request context will be used. In the render process |request_context| must be empty and the context associated with the current renderer process' browser will be used.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.GetRequest
member.summary: Returns the request object used to create this URL request. The returned object is read-only and should not be modified.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.GetClient
member.summary: Returns the client.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.RequestStatus
member.summary: Returns the request status.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.RequestError
member.summary: Returns the request error if status is UR_CANCELED or UR_FAILED, or 0 otherwise.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.GetResponse
member.summary: Returns the response, or NULL if no response information is available. Response information will only be available after the upload has completed. The returned object is read-only and should not be modified.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the request.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented by the CefURLRequest client. The methods of this class will be called on the same thread that created the request unless otherwise documented.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnRequestComplete(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest)
member.summary: Notifies the client that the request has completed. Use the CefURLRequest::GetRequestStatus method to determine if the request was successful or not.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnUploadProgress(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Notifies the client of upload progress. |current| denotes the number of bytes sent so far and |total| is the total size of uploading data (or -1 if chunked upload is enabled). This method will only be called if the UR_FLAG_REPORT_UPLOAD_PROGRESS flag is set on the request.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnDownloadProgress(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Notifies the client of download progress. |current| denotes the number of bytes received up to the call and |total| is the expected total size of the response (or -1 if not determined).

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.OnDownloadData(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequest,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Called when some part of the response is read. |data| contains the current bytes received since the last call. This method will not be called if the UR_FLAG_NO_DOWNLOAD_DATA flag is set on the request.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestClient.GetAuthCredentials(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefAuthCallback)
member.summary: Called on the IO thread when the browser needs credentials from the user. |isProxy| indicates whether the host is a proxy server. |host| contains the hostname and |port| contains the port number. Return true to continue the request and call CefAuthCallback::Continue() when the authentication information is available. Return false to cancel the request. This method will only be called for requests initiated from the browser process.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Accessor
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented to handle V8 function calls. The methods of this class will be called on the thread associated with the V8 function.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Accessor.Get(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle retrieval the accessor value identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the accessor. If retrieval succeeds set |retval| to the return value. If retrieval fails set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if accessor retrieval was handled.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Accessor.Set(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle assignment of the accessor value identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the accessor. |value| is the new value being assigned to the accessor. If assignment fails set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if accessor assignment was handled.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context
member.summary: Class representing a V8 context handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. Valid threads for creating a V8 handle include the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) and WebWorker threads. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetCurrentContext
member.summary: Returns the current (top) context object in the V8 context stack.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetEnteredContext
member.summary: Returns the entered (bottom) context object in the V8 context stack.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.InContext
member.summary: Returns true if V8 is currently inside a context.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetTaskRunner
member.summary: Returns the task runner associated with this context. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. This method can be called on any render process thread.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying handle is valid and it can be accessed on the current thread. Do not call any other methods if this method returns false.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetBrowser
member.summary: Returns the browser for this context. This method will return an empty reference for WebWorker contexts.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetFrame
member.summary: Returns the frame for this context. This method will return an empty reference for WebWorker contexts.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.GetGlobal
member.summary: Returns the global object for this context. The context must be entered before calling this method.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.Enter
member.summary: Enter this context. A context must be explicitly entered before creating a V8 Object, Array, Function or Date asynchronously. Exit() must be called the same number of times as Enter() before releasing this context. V8 objects belong to the context in which they are created. Returns true if the scope was entered successfully.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.Exit
member.summary: Exit this context. Call this method only after calling Enter(). Returns true if the scope was exited successfully.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.IsSame(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context)
member.summary: Returns true if this object is pointing to the same handle as |that| object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context.TryEval(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception@)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified JavaScript code using this context's global object. On success |retval| will be set to the return value, if any, and the function will return true. On failure |exception| will be set to the exception, if any, and the function will return false.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception
member.summary: Class representing a V8 exception. The methods of this class may be called on any render process thread.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.Message
member.summary: Returns the exception message.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.SourceLine
member.summary: Returns the line of source code that the exception occurred within.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.ScriptResourceName
member.summary: Returns the resource name for the script from where the function causing the error originates.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.LineNumber
member.summary: Returns the 1-based number of the line where the error occurred or 0 if the line number is unknown.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.StartPosition
member.summary: Returns the index within the script of the first character where the error occurred.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.EndPosition
member.summary: Returns the index within the script of the last character where the error occurred.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.StartColumn
member.summary: Returns the index within the line of the first character where the error occurred.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Exception.EndColumn
member.summary: Returns the index within the line of the last character where the error occurred.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Handler
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented to handle V8 function calls. The methods of this class will always be called on the render process main thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Handler.Execute(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value[],Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value@,System.String@)
member.summary: Handle execution of the function identified by |name|. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the function. |arguments| is the list of arguments passed to the function. If execution succeeds set |retval| to the function return value. If execution fails set |exception| to the exception that will be thrown. Return true if execution was handled.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame
member.summary: Class representing a V8 stack frame handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. Valid threads for creating a V8 handle include the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) and WebWorker threads. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying handle is valid and it can be accessed on the current thread. Do not call any other methods if this method returns false.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.ScriptName
member.summary: Returns the name of the resource script that contains the function.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.ScriptNameOrSourceUrl
member.summary: Returns the name of the resource script that contains the function or the sourceURL value if the script name is undefined and its source ends with a "//@ sourceURL=..." string.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.FunctionName
member.summary: Returns the name of the function.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.LineNumber
member.summary: Returns the 1-based line number for the function call or 0 if unknown.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.Column
member.summary: Returns the 1-based column offset on the line for the function call or 0 if unknown.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.IsEval
member.summary: Returns true if the function was compiled using eval().

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackFrame.IsConstructor
member.summary: Returns true if the function was called as a constructor via "new".

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace
member.summary: Class representing a V8 stack trace handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. Valid threads for creating a V8 handle include the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) and WebWorker threads. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.GetCurrent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the stack trace for the currently active context. |frame_limit| is the maximum number of frames that will be captured.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying handle is valid and it can be accessed on the current thread. Do not call any other methods if this method returns false.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.FrameCount
member.summary: Returns the number of stack frames.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8StackTrace.GetFrame(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the stack frame at the specified 0-based index.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value
member.summary: Class representing a V8 value handle. V8 handles can only be accessed from the thread on which they are created. Valid threads for creating a V8 handle include the render process main thread (TID_RENDERER) and WebWorker threads. A task runner for posting tasks on the associated thread can be retrieved via the CefV8Context::GetTaskRunner() method.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.CreateArray(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new CefV8Value object of type array with the specified |length|. If |length| is negative the returned array will have length 0. member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.IsUserCreated
member.summary: OBJECT METHODS - These methods are only available on objects. Arrays and functions are also objects. String- and integer-based keys can be used interchangably with the framework converting between them as necessary. Returns true if this is a user created object.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.HasException
member.summary: Returns true if the last method call resulted in an exception. This attribute exists only in the scope of the current CEF value object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetException
member.summary: Returns the exception resulting from the last method call. This attribute exists only in the scope of the current CEF value object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.ClearException
member.summary: Clears the last exception and returns true on success.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.WillRethrowExceptions
member.summary: Returns true if this object will re-throw future exceptions. This attribute exists only in the scope of the current CEF value object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetRethrowExceptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set whether this object will re-throw future exceptions. By default exceptions are not re-thrown. If a exception is re-thrown the current context should not be accessed again until after the exception has been caught and not re-thrown. Returns true on success. This attribute exists only in the scope of the current CEF value object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.HasValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the object has a value with the specified identifier.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.HasValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the object has a value with the specified identifier.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.DeleteValue(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only and don't-delete values this method will return true even though deletion failed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.DeleteValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes the value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly, deletion fails or an exception is thrown. For read-only and don't-delete values this method will return true even though deletion failed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value with the specified identifier on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value with the specified identifier on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.summary: Associates a value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only values this method will return true even though assignment failed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetValue(System.Int32,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value)
member.summary: Associates a value with the specified identifier and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only values this method will return true even though assignment failed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetValue(System.String,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8AccessControl,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8PropertyAttribute)
member.summary: Registers an identifier and returns true on success. Access to the identifier will be forwarded to the CefV8Accessor instance passed to CefV8Value::CreateObject(). Returns false if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown. For read-only values this method will return true even though assignment failed.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.TryGetKeys(System.String[]@)
member.summary: Read the keys for the object's values into the specified vector. Integer- based keys will also be returned as strings.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetKeys
member.summary: Read the keys for the object's values into the specified vector. Integer- based keys will also be returned as strings.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.SetUserData(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUserData)
member.summary: Sets the user data for this object and returns true on success. Returns false if this method is called incorrectly. This method can only be called on user created objects.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetUserData
member.summary: Returns the user data, if any, assigned to this object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetExternallyAllocatedMemory
member.summary: Returns the amount of externally allocated memory registered for the object.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.AdjustExternallyAllocatedMemory(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts the amount of registered external memory for the object. Used to give V8 an indication of the amount of externally allocated memory that is kept alive by JavaScript objects. V8 uses this information to decide when to perform global garbage collection. Each CefV8Value tracks the amount of external memory associated with it and automatically decreases the global total by the appropriate amount on its destruction. |change_in_bytes| specifies the number of bytes to adjust by. This method returns the number of bytes associated with the object after the adjustment. This method can only be called on user created objects.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetArrayLength
member.summary: ARRAY METHODS - These methods are only available on arrays. Returns the number of elements in the array.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetFunctionName
member.summary: FUNCTION METHODS - These methods are only available on functions. Returns the function name.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.GetFunctionHandler
member.summary: Returns the function handler or NULL if not a CEF-created function.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.ExecuteFunction(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value[])
member.summary: Execute the function using the current V8 context. This method should only be called from within the scope of a CefV8Handler or CefV8Accessor callback, or in combination with calling Enter() and Exit() on a stored CefV8Context reference. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the function. If |object| is empty the current context's global object will be used. |arguments| is the list of arguments that will be passed to the function. Returns the function return value on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value.ExecuteFunctionWithContext(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Context,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value,Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefV8Value[])
member.summary: Execute the function using the specified V8 context. |object| is the receiver ('this' object) of the function. If |object| is empty the specified context's global object will be used. |arguments| is the list of arguments that will be passed to the function. Returns the function return value on success. Returns NULL if this method is called incorrectly or an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue
member.summary: Class that wraps other data value types. Complex types (binary, dictionary and list) will be referenced but not owned by this object. Can be used on any process and thread.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.Create
member.summary: Creates a new object.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsValid
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying data is valid. This will always be true for simple types. For complex types (binary, dictionary and list) the underlying data may become invalid if owned by another object (e.g. list or dictionary) and that other object is then modified or destroyed. This value object can be re-used by calling Set*() even if the underlying data is invalid.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsOwned
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying data is owned by another object.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Returns true if the underlying data is read-only. Some APIs may expose read-only objects.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsSame(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue)
member.summary: Returns true if this object and |that| object have the same underlying data. If true modifications to this object will also affect |that| object and vice-versa.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue.IsEqual(Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefValue)
member.summary: Returns true if this object and |that| object have an equivalent underlying value but are not necessarily the same object.

member.summary: Method that will be called once for each plugin. |count| is the 0-based index for the current plugin. |total| is the total number of plugins. Return false to stop visiting plugins. This method may never be called if no plugins are found.

member.summary: Interface to implement for receiving unstable plugin information. The methods of this class will be called on the browser process IO thread.

member.summary: Method that will be called for the requested plugin. |unstable| will be true if the plugin has reached the crash count threshold of 3 times in 120 seconds.

member.summary: Close the document. This should be called directly to ensure that cleanup occurs on the correct thread.

member.summary: Returns true if an error has been reported by the XML parser.

member.summary: Returns the error string.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.NodeType
member.summary: The below methods retrieve data for the node at the current cursor position. Returns the node type.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Depth
member.summary: Returns the node depth. Depth starts at 0 for the root node.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.LocalName
member.summary: Returns the local name. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/#NT-LocalPart for additional details.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Prefix
member.summary: Returns the namespace prefix. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/ for additional details.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.QualifiedName
member.summary: Returns the qualified name, equal to (Prefix:)LocalName. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/#ns-qualnames for additional details.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.NamespaceUri
member.summary: Returns the URI defining the namespace associated with the node. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/ for additional details.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.BaseUri
member.summary: Returns the base URI of the node. See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for additional details.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.XmlLang
member.summary: Returns the xml:lang scope within which the node resides. See http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/#sec-lang-tag for additional details.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.IsEmptyElement
member.summary: Returns true if the node represents an empty element. is considered empty but is not.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.HasValue
member.summary: Returns true if the node has a text value.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.Value
member.summary: Returns the text value.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.HasAttributes
member.summary: Returns true if the node has attributes.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.AttributeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of attributes.

member.summary: Returns the value of the attribute at the specified 0-based index.

member.summary: Returns the value of the attribute with the specified qualified name.

member.summary: Returns the value of the attribute with the specified local name and namespace URI.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.GetOuterXml
member.summary: Returns an XML representation of the current node including its children.

member.name: P:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.LineNumber

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attribute nodes are not traversed by default. The below methods can be used to move the cursor to an attribute node. MoveToCarryingElement() can be called afterwards to return the cursor to the carrying element. The depth of an attribute node will be 1 + the depth of the carrying element. Moves the cursor to the attribute at the specified 0-based index. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the attribute with the specified qualified name. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the attribute with the specified local name and namespace URI. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the first attribute in the current element. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the next attribute in the current element. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: M:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefXmlReader.MoveToCarryingElement
member.summary: Moves the cursor back to the carrying element. Returns true if the cursor position was set successfully.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation
member.summary: CEF offers two context safety implementations with different performance characteristics.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation.SafeDefault
member.summary: The default implementation (value of 0) uses a map of hash values and should provide better performance in situations with a small number contexts.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation.SafeAlternate
member.summary: The alternate implementation (value of 1) uses a hidden value attached to each context and should provide better performance in situations with a large number of contexts.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefContextSafetyImplementation.Disabled
member.summary: If you need better performance in the creation of V8 references and you plan to manually track context lifespan you can disable context safety by specifying a value of -1.

member.summary: This option instructs the writer that if a Binary value is encountered, the value (and key if within a dictionary) will be omitted from the output, and success will be returned. Otherwise, if a binary value is encountered, failure will be returned.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefJsonWriterOptions.OmitDoubleTypePreservation
member.summary: This option instructs the writer to write doubles that have no fractional part as a normal integer (i.e., without using exponential notation or appending a '.0') as long as the value is within the range of a 64-bit int.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefJsonWriterOptions.PrettyPrint
member.summary: Return a slightly nicer formatted json string (pads with whitespace to help with readability).

member.summary: Notification that a key was pressed. This does not necessarily correspond to a character depending on the key and language. Use KEYEVENT_CHAR for character input.

member.summary: Notification that a key was released.

member.summary: Notification that a character was typed. Use this for text input. Key down events may generate 0, 1, or more than one character event depending on the key, locale, and operating system.

member.summary: Policy for how the Referrer HTTP header value will be sent during navigation. If the `--no-referrers` command-line flag is specified then the policy value will be ignored and the Referrer value will never be sent.

member.summary: Use the default policy. This is REFERRER_POLICY_ORIGIN_WHEN_CROSS_ORIGIN when the `--reduced-referrer-granularity` command-line flag is specified and REFERRER_POLICY_NO_REFERRER_WHEN_DOWNGRADE otherwise.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.NoReferrerWhenDowngrade
member.summary: When navigating from HTTPS to HTTP do not send the Referrer value. Otherwise, send the complete Referrer value.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.Never
member.summary: Never send the Referrer value.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.Origin
member.summary: Only send the origin component of the Referrer value.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefReferrerPolicy.OriginWhenCrossOrigin
member.summary: When navigating cross-origin only send the origin component of the Referrer value. Otherwise, send the complete Referrer value.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType
member.summary: Transition type for a request. Made up of one source value and 0 or more qualifiers.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.Link
member.summary: Source is a link click or the JavaScript window.open function. This is also the default value for requests like sub-resource loads that are not navigations.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.Explicit
member.summary: Source is some other "explicit" navigation action such as creating a new browser or using the LoadURL function. This is also the default value for navigations where the actual type is unknown.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.AutoSubframe
member.summary: Source is a subframe navigation. This is any content that is automatically loaded in a non-toplevel frame. For example, if a page consists of several frames containing ads, those ad URLs will have this transition type. The user may not even realize the content in these pages is a separate frame, so may not care about the URL.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.ManualSubframe
member.summary: Source is a subframe navigation explicitly requested by the user that will generate new navigation entries in the back/forward list. These are probably more important than frames that were automatically loaded in the background because the user probably cares about the fact that this link was loaded.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.FormSubmit
member.summary: Source is a form submission by the user. NOTE: In some situations submitting a form does not result in this transition type. This can happen if the form uses a script to submit the contents.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.Reload
member.summary: Source is a "reload" of the page via the Reload function or by re-visiting the same URL. NOTE: This is distinct from the concept of whether a particular load uses "reload semantics" (i.e. bypasses cached data).

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.SourceMask
member.summary: General mask defining the bits used for the source values.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.BlockedFlag
member.summary: Attempted to visit a URL but was blocked.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.ForwardBackFlag
member.summary: Used the Forward or Back function to navigate among browsing history.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.ChainStartFlag
member.summary: The beginning of a navigation chain.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.ChainEndFlag
member.summary: The last transition in a redirect chain.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.ClientRedirectFlag
member.summary: Redirects caused by JavaScript or a meta refresh tag on the page.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.ServerRedirectFlag
member.summary: Redirects sent from the server by HTTP headers.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.IsRedirectMask
member.summary: Used to test whether a transition involves a redirect.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefTransitionType.QualifierMask
member.summary: General mask defining the bits used for the qualifiers.

member.name: T:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules
member.summary: URI unescape rules passed to CefURIDecode().

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules.None
member.summary: Don't unescape anything at all.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules.Normal
member.summary: Don't unescape anything special, but all normal unescaping will happen. This is a placeholder and can't be combined with other flags (since it's just the absence of them). All other unescape rules imply "normal" in addition to their special meaning. Things like escaped letters, digits, and most symbols will get unescaped with this mode.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules.Spaces
member.summary: Convert %20 to spaces. In some places where we're showing URLs, we may want this. In places where the URL may be copied and pasted out, then you wouldn't want this since it might not be interpreted in one piece by other applications.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules.PathSeparators
member.summary: Unescapes '/' and '\\'. If these characters were unescaped, the resulting URL won't be the same as the source one. Moreover, they are dangerous to unescape in strings that will be used as file paths or names. This value should only be used when slashes don't have special meaning, like data URLs.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules.UrlSpecialCharsExceptPathSeparators
member.summary: Unescapes various characters that will change the meaning of URLs, including '%', '+', '&', '#'. Does not unescape path separators. If these characters were unescaped, the resulting URL won't be the same as the source one. This flag is used when generating final output like filenames for URLs where we won't be interpreting as a URL and want to do as much unescaping as possible.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules.SpoofingAndControlChars
member.summary:
Unescapes characters that can be used in spoofing attempts (such as LOCK) and control characters (such as BiDi control characters and %01). This INCLUDES NULLs. This is used for rare cases such as data: URL decoding where the result is binary data.
DO NOT use UU_SPOOFING_AND_CONTROL_CHARS if the URL is going to be displayed in the UI for security reasons.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUriUnescapeRules.ReplacePlusWithSpace
member.summary: URL queries use "+" for space. This flag controls that replacement.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestOptions.None
member.summary: Default behavior.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestOptions.SkipCache
member.summary: If set the cache will be skipped when handling the request.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestOptions.AllowCachedCredentials
member.summary: If set user name, password, and cookies may be sent with the request, and cookies may be saved from the response.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestOptions.ReportUploadProgress
member.summary: If set upload progress events will be generated when a request has a body.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestOptions.NoDownloadData
member.summary: If set the CefUrlRequestClient.OnDownloadData method will not be called.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestOptions.NoRetryOn5XX
member.summary: If set 5XX redirect errors will be propagated to the observer instead of automatically re-tried. This currently only applies for requests originated in the browser process.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestStatus.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown status.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestStatus.Success
member.summary: Request succeeded.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestStatus.IOPending
member.summary: An IO request is pending, and the caller will be informed when it is completed.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestStatus.Canceled
member.summary: Request was canceled programatically.

member.name: F:Internal.Xilium.CefGlue.CefUrlRequestStatus.Failed
member.summary: Request failed for some reason.

If a BOM is detected and the correct decoder is available then that decoder will be used automatically.
